title: Spheniscidae: Dragonflies and damselflies
description:
pochamarama:

Dragonflies and damselflies are both fierce aerial predators belonging to the Order Odonata. Their wings cannot be folded over the abdomen in a way characteristic of other insects (grasshoppers, bees, true bugs, beetles, etc.). They share this distinction with mayflies, and are placed together in…
